title: Make AccessControlAction to update permissions only when required
body:
### Changes

This PR looks like a lot of changes but it is not. It has several unrelated changes in a single PR
#### Major changes
1. Major change is in `AccessControlAction` to not make unecessary `FileSystem` calls. With this change, `AccessControlAction` calls `fs.setPermission` and `fs.setOwner` if the permissions and owner of a path are different from what the user wants. To make this change I had to move around some code because the current `FileSystemDatasetVersion` does not know the `FileStatus` of a `DatasetVersion`. It only knows the `Path`.
2. Currently `DatasetCleanerJob` only supports running retention on datasets that import a tag. The only way to run retention on multiple kinds of datasets  that import different tags is to have different jobs. I have added multi tag support in this pr. The same key `gobblin.retention.tag` is now a comma separated list of tags in the config store. (Internal ask from ops ETL-4855)
#### Minor trivial changes
1. Logging in retention was too verbose and useless. Moved some of them to debug. Added `@ToString` to all the version selection policies for more meaningful logs
2. By default the hive based retention used to delete data as well. Looking at the use cases, it seems like the default should to not delete data. Changed it in `CleanableHiveDataset` and a few unit tests.
3. Chagned the `DEFAULT_MAX_CONCURRENT_DATASETS_CLEANED` to 100 from 1000. Since we have more actions like `AccessControl`, I expect more namenode calls. There is no need to stress the namenode because retention is not a time critical job.
4. Added simulate mode for `AccessControlAction`

@ydai1124 and @ibuenros  can you review?

title: Make Quartz initialization backward compatible in SchedulerService
body: Changes to SchedulerService were breaking backward compatibility, because irrespective of whether or not properties at initialization time in SchedulerDaemon had quartz related properties, it was being used to initialize SchedulerFactory; which in turn was making the SchedulerFactory to ignore quartz.properties file in classpath and failing to acquire requisite configs to boot up.

title: Prioritization for distcp
body:
This PR implements distcp prioritization in two parts:

Commit 1: Implements the request allocation interfaces and implementations. Suggested order of review:
- Start with `RequestAllocator` interface, which has a description of the request allocation problem and model.
- Look at the basic interfaces/classes `Request`, `Requestor`, `ResourceEstimator`, `ResourcePool`, `ResourceRequirement`.
- Look at specific subclasses `PushDownRequestor`, `HierarchicalPrioritizer`, `SimpleHierarchicalPrioritizer`.
- Look at `RequestAllocator` implementations: `AllEqualAllocator`, `BruteForceAllocator`, `HierarchicalAllocator`, `PreOrderAllocator`.
- Look at unit tests for `RequestAllocator` implementations to get an idea on how to use them.
- Look at supporting classes `ConcurrentBoundedPriorityIterable`, `VectorAlgebra`.

Commit 2: uses request allocation to implement prioritization for distcp. Suggested order of review:
- Start with `CopyResourcePool`, which specifies the resources used in distcp (total byte size and number of copy entities).
- Look at changes in `FileSet` which now implements `Request` and is an interface, as well as `FileSetResourceEstimator`.
- Look at `HiveFileSet`, `HivePartitionFileSet`, `HivePartitionsDeregisterFileSet`, and `UnpartitionedTableFileSet` which are implementations of `FileSet` for Hive distcp.
- Look at `CopyableDatasetRequestor`, which wraps a `CopyableDatasetBase` to make it a `Requestor`, as well as `PrioritizedCopyableDataset` which allows push down of prioritizers to the copyable dataset.
- Look at changes in `CopyConfiguration` to parse requirements for prioritization.
- Look at changes in `CopySource` to actually implement the prioritization.
- Look at unit tests to see how prioritization is used.

title: Adding GobblinTestEventBusWriter
body:
Adding some instrumentation to allow us to test end-to-end gobblin jobs.

The idea is to write output to a Guava EventBus and then have some utilities to assert the output.

Changes:
- TestingEventBuses - maintains a global list of testing event buses. This is to simplify the sharing of buses between the writer(s) and the asserter(s).
- GobblinTestEventBusWriter - a writer implementation to write to an EventBus managed by TestingEventBuses
- TestingEventBusAsserter - helper functions to do asserts on the incoming events from TestingEventBuses.
- Unit tests.

@ibuenros @abti can you review?

title: [AvroToOrc] Use comma separated list for hiveRuntime properties
body:
Currently `hiveRuntime` properties are set in the config store as 

```
hiveRuntime : {
      mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize=32000000
      mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize.per.node=32000000
}

```

Since we use `TypeSafeConfig` to parse, the config  `mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize.per.node=32000000` is overwritten by `mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize=32000000`

Hence changing the syntax of `hiveRuntime` to a list of key value pairs.

```
hiveRuntime : [
      mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize,32000000
      ,mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize.per.node,32000000
]
```

@abti can you review?

title: Code hygiene for (Immutable)FSJobCatalog
body:
Changes:
- ImmutableFSJobCatalog.ConfigAccessor should now be able to read JOB_CONFIG_FILE_DIR_KEY for backwards compatibility. The directory path will be treated as a local (current semantics).
- Moved the jobConfigDir path and FileSystem construction from ImmutableFSJobCatalog to ImmutableFSJobCatalog.ConfigAccessor . Currently, the file system is constructed using default configuration (new Configuration()). Eventually, we should allow to inject other Hadoop configuration through the Config object.
- Moved FSJobCatalogHelper.materializedJobSpec() to FSJobCatalog as this is the only place it was used and made the method non-static.
- Moved FSJobCatalogHelper.JobSpecConverter to ImmutableFSJobCatalog as it is specific to that implementation.
- Moved FSJobCatalogHelper.addPathAlterationObserver to PathAlterationDetector as it is modifying its state and made the method non-static.
- Removed FSJobCatalogHelper class

title: Replace DatePartitionedDailyAvroSource with configurable partitioning
body:
This PR is a continuation of PR https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1196 .

Currently the `DatePartitionedDailyAvroSource` can only read daily partitioned data.
This PR extends this functionality by introducing `DatePartitionedAvroFileSource` in which the partitioning is configurable by the properties as follows:

> date.partitioned.source.partition.prefix
> date.partitioned.source.partition.suffix
> date.partitioned.source.partition.pattern
> date.partitioned.source.partition.granularity

This is the _reader equivalent_ of the time-based writer and partitioner, found in `TimeBasedWriterPartitioner` and `TimePartitionedDataPublisher`.
With this add-on new data sets can be read using different temporal granularity, not just as daily partitioned data.

title: Various fixes to standalone and additions for boss workshop
body:
Parts of this PR:
- New converters: `GobblinMetricsFlattenerConverter` (flattens Metric report), `SchemaInjector` (injects a string schema to sources that can't provide a schema), `AvroToJsonStringConverter`, `JsonToStringConverter` (uses Gson to serialize json into string), `StringToBytesConverter` (using UTF8 encoding).
- New/improved sources/extractors: `FixedSchemaKafkaAvroExtractor`: allows ingesting avro topics wiht a fixed schema when schema registry is not available, `SimpleKafkaSource`: single entry point to Kafka extractors.
- `WikipediaSource` refactoring: previously Wikipedia source would simply pull the last 10 revisions over and over, which is not a good way of showing Gobblins capabilities. Modified it so it pulls revisions, remembers last revision pulled per article, and pushes new revisions each run.
- Some fixes to `KafkaAvroReporter`.
- Fixes to `JobScheduler` to improve standalone Gobblin execution: exit Gobblin correctly on failure of services, skip invalid pull files, etc.
- Bug fixes to pull file change detector.
- Updated templates and moved them to `gobblin-runtime`.

title: Use avro permission for orc data
body:
- Manually create ORC data location with the same permissions as Avro data
- Note that hive can also automatically create the non-existing directories, but it does not
  seem to create it with the desired permissions.
  According to hive docs, permissions for newly created directories/files can be controlled using uMask.
  I tried the following but it did not honor the umask

```
hive (default)> SET hive.warehouse.subdir.inherit.perms=false;
hive (default)> SET fs.permissions.umask-mode=022;
hive (default)> CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `testtable` (`Id` int, `Urn` string) LOCATION '/user/pcadabam/testtable';
OK
Time taken: 6.031 seconds
```

Directory got created with 750 permissions. Expected is 755
@abti can you review?

title: Refactored MR mode to use GobblinInputFormat.
body:
Implements an `InputFormat` for Gobblin that does not require a single file to be read by all mappers.

Fixes the following issue:
Gobblin MR writes a file with extension *.wulist containing a list of *.wu and *.mwu files for mappers to process. Each of these mappers must read this single file, which can cause slowness in HDFS or affect datanodes.

title: Fixed silent failures and hung application when a standalone service
body:
fails to initialize.

Issue:
Previously, if `JobScheduler` failed to start, the application would hang and no error would be reported.

Solution:
Added a listener to the `ServiceManager` in `ServiceBasedAppLauncher` that logs failures of the services and shutdowns Gobblin on failure of a service.
Also separated the quartz scheduler as an independent service managed in the `ServiceManager`. This is necessary because otherwise, when `JobScheduler` fails, its `shutDown` method cannot be called, so the scheduler cannot be closed, causing the application to hang. As a separate service, the `ServiceManager` will shutdown the scheduler correctly.

title: Make topic suffix configurable for lookup in Confluent Schema Registry
body:
Currently only the name of the Kafka topic is used to retrieve the schema from the registry, however schemas are usually registered under `topicName-value` or `topicName-key`. 
Thus the schema will never be retrieved from the registry and the following exception is thrown:

```
...
Caused by: gobblin.metrics.kafka.SchemaRegistryException:
io.confluent.kafka.schemaregistry.client.rest.exceptions.RestClientException:
Subject not found.; error code: 40401
...
```

This PR adds a new config parameter `kafka.schema_registry.confluent.schema.name.suffix`which defaults to `-value`. This suffix will be used along with the topic name to query the registry.

title: Move lock attempt into AbstractJobLauncher's constructor
body:
`MRJobLauncher` deletes the working directory before the lock is checked. See (https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/blob/3f5939c2521061c633ee082bb954a98ab9027f54/gobblin-runtime/src/main/java/gobblin/runtime/mapreduce/MRJobLauncher.java#L149). 

This causes the running job that has the lock to fail when it tries to read files in the working directory. Moving the lock check into `AbstractJobLauncher`'s constructor prevents subclasses from doing destructive operations like this without having the lock.

The diff here is ugly due to whitespace but the change is relatively simple.
See https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/commit/a0ac0a39af26fe6fd15f05ae632ad4a0055c7812?w=1 to view the diff without whitespace

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: AvroToorc - Implemented a per partition watermark
body:
### Changes

For every Table we create a NoOp watermark WorkUnit that stores watermarks for all its Partitions as a `Map`. This workunit is identified by the property `IS_WATERMARK_WORKUNIT_KEY` being set to `true`.
This workunit is intended to only carry watermark state and does not contain any business logic to execute hive conversion queries.

The watermark is stored as a `MultiKeyValueLongWatermark` which is an extension to `Map` that implements gobblin's `Watermark` interface. The key is a Partition identifier and value is the watermark for this Partition

The maximum number of Partition watermarks for each Table can be adjusted by the property MAX_PARTITIONS_IN_WATERMARK_PER_DATASET_KEY, The default is 50. This means we only track watermarks for 50 most recently modified partitions of each table. If a previous watermark is not found for as partition, it returns 0 as the watermark

A `TableLevelWatermarer` is still supported. It can be used instead of a `PartitionLevelWatermarker`

Note that the publish logic is still at a per `Table` level. We still fail all partitions if any partition fails. Per partition commit is doable but is an optimization we can work on later.

@chavdar and @abti  can you review?

Internal jira ticket - ETL-4785

title: Bug fix - Retention does not blacklist dataset
body:
## Root cause

`ConfigurableCleanableDataset` was calling the incorrect super constructor `super(fs, jobProps, log)` instead of `super(fs, jobProps, config, log)`
## Impact

When retention job is configured through config store, each dataset can be blacklisted by setting `gobblin.retention.is.blacklisted=true`. Since the wrong constructor was being called, this value was never passed to the super class. Hence the dataset was not blacklisted.

@chavdar can you review?

repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Fix SchedulerUtils bugs for loading config file on hdfs
body:
bugs appeared when testing on Azkaban. (try-with-resources one and loading a single config file one) Could you help for the review? @ibuenros   

---

Bugs detail: 
- In `SchedulerUtils.java: loadGenericJobConfig`  method, the loading of single configuration file process is buggy, as it hard coded  "file://" prefix which is not compatible for file system except local fs. The solution is to change it to use `PropertiesConfiguration` object for loading a `inputStream` instead. 
- The instance of FileSystem will be closed with try-with-resources implementation, which is not expected for periodically running scenario. May need to redesign this later.

title: Slaeventmonitor
body:
This PR implements a SLA event monitor which will generate JobSpecs from SLA events received in a Kafka topic.

Main classes:
- `KafkaAvroJobMonitor`: extends `KafkaJobMonitor`, parsing the events with a fixed avro schema.
- `SLAEventKafkaJobMonitor`: extends `KafkaAvroJobMonitor` to parse SLA events. It uses an input template, and can apply name or dataset urn filters, as well as mapping certain metadata of the sla event into configurations for the Gobblin job.

Other major changes:
- Added metrics to `KafkaJobMonitor` and `HighLevelConsumer`.
- Lots of tests.

title: Configurable partitioning in DatePartitionedDailyAvroSource
body:
Currently the `DatePartitionedDailyAvroSource` can only read _daily_ partitioned data.
This PR extends this functionality by introducing `DatePartitionedAvroFileSource` in which the partitioning is configurable by the properties as follows:

> date.partitioned.source.partition.prefix
> date.partitioned.source.partition.suffix
> date.partitioned.source.partition.pattern
> date.partitioned.source.partition.granularity

In this way an arbitrarily partitioned data (e.g written out by `TimeBasedWriterPartitioner`) can be read with the same temporal granularity configuration.

title: TeradataWriter implementation
body:
With this PR I'd like to add the capability of writing to Teradata.
- Writing is done through batch inserts 
- The final table should be created beforehand which is ideally a _MULTISET_ table
  _without a primary index_.
- Writer specific jars (**tdgssconfig** and **terajdbc4**) need to be passed to the job 

Excerpt from a job definition:

> # Converter
> converter.classes=gobblin.converter.jdbc.AvroToJdbcEntryConverter
> 
> # Writer
> writer.destination.type=TERADATA
> writer.builder.class=gobblin.writer.JdbcWriterBuilder
> 
> # Publish
> data.publisher.job.type=gobblin.publisher.JdbcPublisher
> jdbc.publisher.url=jdbc:teradata://host
> jdbc.publisher.driver=com.teradata.jdbc.TeraDriver

Tests:
Export 30M records with and without staging tables to Teradata 15.10
both from HDFS and Kafka sources.

---

Additional fix: class `resourcesBasedTemplate` was renamed to `ResourcesBasedTemplate` which caused Findbug checks to fail

title: More changes toward an end-to-end flow with the new APIS
body:
Changes to the new API:
- Made GobblinInstanceLauncher extend configurable since it is responsible of holding the system configuration
- Added initial version of JobExecutionDriver and modified JobExecutionLauncher to return JobExecutionDriver
- Added a JobLauncherExecutionDriver which acts as an adapter to the legacy JobLauncher/JobLauncherFactory API
- Reworked JobSpec.Builder to be convention-based and be able to reuse some of the properties in the Job configuration
- Added StandardGobblinInstanceDriver and StandardGobblinInstanceLauncher-- a very rudimentary implementations of GobblinInstanceDriver and GobblinInstanceLauncher

Changes to legacy code:
- Documentation and helper methods in JobState to decrease reliance on direct access to job properties
- Helper methods in JobContext
- Added a method JobLauncherFactory. newJobLauncher() method to allow instantiating a specific JobLauncher

@ibuenros @autumnust can you review ?

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: IllegalArgumentException in JdbcPublisher when staging tables are skipped
body:
When publishing to an RDBMS and staging tables are skipped 
(`job.commit.policy=partial` and `publish.data.at.job.level=false`) the following exception is thrown in the tasks:

```
ERROR [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.runtime.TaskExecutor: Thread Thread[TaskExecutor-0,5,main]
 threw an uncaught exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot instantiate
    JdbcPublisher since it does not extend SingleTaskDataPublisher
      at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:93)
      at gobblin.publisher.SingleTaskDataPublisher.getInstance(SingleTaskDataPublisher.java:67)
      at gobblin.runtime.Task.publishTaskData(Task.java:313)
      at gobblin.runtime.Task.run(Task.java:251)
```

The problem is that `JdbcPublisher extends DataPublisher` however, according to PR https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/360 task level publishers should extend `SingleTaskDataPublisher`.
With this patch I'd propose to change to `JdbcPublisher extends SingleTaskDataPublisher` and instead of throwing an unchecked exception in its constructor, let just log that the commit has already been done in the tasks.

@zliu41 , @jinhyukchang what do you think?
